title: Medication Regimen Complexity-Intensive Care Unit (MRC-ICU) Score
description: Predicts patient outcomes (mortality, length of stay), ICU complications (fluid overload), and pharmacist workload (amount and intensity of intervention) in the ICU. The MRC-ICU is an objective, quantitative scoring tool that describes the relative complexity of medication regimens in critically ill patients.

result.name: mrc_icu_score
result.description: Total MRC-ICU score indicating medication regimen complexity

ranges.interpretation: Lower MRC-ICU score suggests relatively simple medication regimen with lower anticipated pharmacist workload. Associated with lower mortality risk and shorter ICU length of stay.

Moderate MRC-ICU score indicates intermediate medication regimen complexity. Mean score in validation studies was approximately 10.3. Each 1-point increase is associated with 7% increased odds of mortality and 0.25 day increase in ICU LOS.

High MRC-ICU score indicates complex medication regimen requiring intensive pharmacist monitoring and intervention. Associated with significantly increased mortality risk, longer ICU stay, and need for extensive pharmacist workload.

formula: MRC-ICU = Sum of all weighted medication scores. Each medication category has specific point values (1-3 points), with some categories multiplied by the number of medications in that category.
notes: The complete MRC-ICU tool consists of 39 discrete medication items.
Score should be calculated at 24-hour intervals during ICU stay.
Higher scores correlate with increased mortality, longer ICU length of stay, and greater pharmacist workload.
Every 1-point increase in MRC-ICU score is associated with 7% increased odds of mortality.
This simplified version includes the most commonly used high-impact medications.
For complete scoring, refer to the full 39-item validated tool.
